intro: Thesium linophyllum, commonly known as the white sand lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, while its stems are often prostrate or spreading. Thesium linophyllum is an important component of the coastal plain ecosystems where it is found.
